161158-d-09-25-00-SOO.Narrative: 0700 STINSON SWITCH WAS RETURNING FROM RICES POINT YARD WITH 53 CARS (4 LOADS, 49 EMPTIES, 1,870 ETT) ON THE B-LINE TO YARD THEIR TRAIN IN STINSON YARD.  ABOUT 20 CAR LENGTHS PAST THE MAIN/B-LINE SWITCH THE ENGINEER FELT THE TRAIN WAS ACTING STRANGE AND TOLD THE CONDUCTOR SO. THEY STOPPED THE MOVEMENT AND WALKED BACK AND FOUND 3 CARS ON THE GROUND.  POD APPEARED TO BE ABOUT 330 FEET FROM WHERE THECARS CAME TO REST. THE FIRST CAR OFF THE TRACK APPEARS TO HAVE BEEN THE SOO 116566, THE MIDDLE CAROF THE THREE DERAILED. THIS CAR HAD BOTH TRUCKS ON THE GROUND. THE OTHER TWO CARS EACH HAD ONE TRUCKON THE GROUND, ON EACH IT WAS THE TRUCK COUPLED TO THE MIDDLE CAR. THE SOO (MIDDLE CAR) HAD ONE OFIT'S BOTTOM HATCH DOORS TORN OFF. THIS WAS FOUND WEST OF THE DERAILMENT AND MARKS ON THE RAIL MAKE IT APPEAR THIS APPARATUS WAS DOWN ON THE RAIL AND DRAGGING ON THE RAIL AND IN THE BALLAST PRIOR TO DERAILMENT.  THIS IS A 10 MPH TRACK.  THE ENGINEER ESTIMATED TRAIN'S SPEED TO BE ABOUT 10 MPH.  ENGINEER ADVISED HE WAS PULLING IN ABOUT 1 THROTTLE, NO AIR BRAKES APPLIED UNTIL HE FELT HE SHOULD STOP ACCOUNT PULLING STRANGELY.  CREW WAS RELEASED AFTER PHONE INTERVIEW.  DOWNLOAD OF UNITS MADE, PULSE TAPES WILL BE FORWARDED FOR ANALYSIS.  HULCHER WAS CONTACTED AND WILL RERAIL AT 8:00 A.M., TUESDAY, SEPT. 26TH.   NO UHR TESTING PERFORMED.  PHOTOS WERE TAKEN.  DAMAGE: 60 TIES DAMAGED, 2 BOLTS BROKEN ON THE WC TRACK GUARD RAIL. NO DAMAGE TO THE RAIL. THIS PER THE SECTION FOREMAN.

161017-d-09-19-00-SOO.Primary Accident Cause: Failure to apply hand brakes on car(s) (railroad employee)
161017-d-09-19-00-SOO.Accident Cause: Failure to apply hand brakes on car(s) (railroad employee)
161017-d-09-19-00-SOO.Narrative: TRAIN #159 ROAD SWITCHER WAS IN THE PROCESS OF SWITCHING CARS AT THIEF RIVER FALLS AND SWITCHED 28 CARS ONTO THE MAIN TRACK, WITH NO HANDBRAKES APPLIED. TRAIN 159 THEN PROCEEDED TO TRACK #8 TO LIFT MORE CARS TO SWITCH ON TOP OF CARS IN THE MAIN TRACK.  WHILE PULLING 44 CARS EASTWARD ON THE LEAD TRACK (ADJACENT TO MAIN TRACK), LOCOMOTIVE ENGINEER OBSERVED CUT OF CARS ON THE ADJACENT MAIN TRACK TO BE CLOSE, BUT CONTINUED TO PULL EASTWARD.  WHEN TRAIN 159 REACHED THE CLEARANCE POINT, LOCOMOTIVE ENGINEER HEARD A SCRAPING SOUND AND SUBSEQUENTLY BROUGHT HIS MOVEMENT TO A STOP.  INITIAL INSPECTION REVEALED THAT TRAIN 159 HAD SIDESWIPED EASTERNMOST CUT OF CARS.  IT WAS SUBSEQUENTLY DEVELOPED THAT THE CUT OF CARS HAD ROLLED EASTWARD, RESULTING IN THE EASTERNMOST CAR FOULING THE LEAD TRACK.  NO DERAILMENT OF UNIT/CARS WAS INCURRED HOWEVER, DAMAGE TO EQUIPMENT RESULTED IN MISHAP MEETING FRA REPORTING THRESHOLD.  NO TRACK DAMAGE OR INJURIES WERE INCURRED AS A RESULT OF INCIDENT.   UHR TESTING WASPERFORMED.   ALL APPROPRIATE ENTITIES ADVISED.  ROOT CAUSE OF INCIDENT :  BRAKMAN FAILED TO APPLY HANDBRAKE DURING A SWITCHING OPERATION PER AIR BRAKE AND TRAIN HANDLING RULE 1.4.   EMPLOYEE WAS AWAREOF THE RULE AND REQUIREMENT AND DID NOT APPLY THE HANDBRAKE, TAKING A SHORTCUT.  RECOMMENDED CORRECTIVE ACTION # 1: CONDUCT A POSITIVE ACTION PLAN WITH THE EMPLOYEE.   WILL REVIEW THE FOLLOWING: *ABTH RULE 1.4 * TIMETABLE SPECIAL INSTRUCTION , NEW RULE 1.48 (VERBAL COMMUNICATION) *GCOR RULE
